```{r setup, message = FALSE}
library("ggplot2")
library("dplyr")
```

```{r}
smaller <- diamonds %>% 
  filter(carat <= 2.5)
```

```{r include = FALSE, purl = FALSE}
larger <- nrow(diamonds) - nrow(smaller)
percentage_larger <- larger / nrow(diamonds) * 100

comma <- function(x) {
  format(x, digits = 3, big.mark = ",")
}
```

## Percentage of diamonds larger than 2.5 carats

Our data is about `r comma(nrow(diamonds))` diamonds.
`r larger` are larger than 2.5 carats. In percentage this will be `r round(percentage_larger, 1)`%.

See the graph below:

```{r}
smaller %>% 
  ggplot(aes(carat)) +
  geom_freqpoly(binwidth = 0.2)
```
